out_desc_tool: This test is based on original Piagetian protocols. It assesses children 's ability to perceive the horizontality of the surface of water in a bottle as the bottle is tilted, and the verticality of a plumb line under similar circumstances.

The EOWPVT is a norm-referenced measure of vocabulary that assesses the child’s ability to use words and requires the child to access and retrieve words from memory. The internal consistency reliability of the measure is .98.
out_desc_red: The EOWPVT is a norm-referenced measure of vocabulary that assesses the child’s ability to use words and requires the child to access and retrieve words from memory. The internal consistency reliability of the measure is .98.

out_desc_tool: The test consists of 60 items divided into ﬁve parts (called sets A through E). Each of the 60 pages, one item per page, is divided into two half-pages. On the upper half, a matrix of ﬁgures is depicted con- taining a missing element. This element has to be detected among the six alternatives (sets A and B) or eight alternatives (sets C through E) printed at the bottom of the page.

The test was presented in two parts, each part using a different set of materials. One part, hereafter referred to as the house part, involved questions about a model house.The other, hereafter referred to as the chemicals part, involved questions about chemical reactions with safe, household chemicals.The model househad two handles (knife switches)and a push button switch on the outside,and a doorbell and a light inside.The light was visible through a small window when the light was on and the window open. TESTThe test consisted of 24 itemsin all.Six items applied to eachof the four principles.Each group of*six items is referredto as an itemgroup.Three of the items in each itemgroup were the suppositional formof the questions asked ofthe children while the otherthree were the factual forms. Some of the items for each principlewere from the house part and the rest from the chemicals part.
M3, M4, and M5 items from SPM task were included in the test.

out_tit_tool: Dictated Spelling Test-training words (immediate post-test mean/sd)
out_desc_tool: The dictated spelling test consisted of 15 of the 20 training words plus five transfer words. The transfer words rhymed with the target words and differed only in the beginning letter. During spelling dictation, each word was presented alone, in the content of a sentence, and then alone again  the students were instructed to make their best guess when they were unsure of a correct spelling. It was stressed that students should attempt a spelling for each word.
out_type_tool: ['Toolkit primary outcome', 'Writing and spelling primary outcome.']

out_desc_tool: An standardised test of the level of cognitive functioning.
Cattell’s Culture Fair Test (CFI 2), a consisting of inductive reasoning subtests.

Vocabulary test (VT) was used to measure crystallized intelligence. Because the children were not yet able to read fluently enough, a vocabulary test was chosen which required the participants to identify a spoken word by marking the correct choice of four familiar pictures. The children had 20 s/item. The test consisted of 35 items.
out_desc_red: Vocabulary test (VT) was used to measure crystallized intelligence. Because the children were not yet able to read fluently enough, a vocabulary test was chosen which required the participants to identify a spoken word by marking the correct choice of four familiar pictures. The children had 20 s/item. The test consisted of 35 items.

out_desc_tool: This test was based on the comprehension test in Astington and Pelletier (2003). After preliminary training on how to answer forced choice questions, children were told a story with accompanying pictures and eight questions each of which required differentiation between two metacognitive verbs.
out_desc_red: This test was based on the comprehension test in Astington and Pelletier (2003). After preliminary training on how to answer forced choice questions, children were told a story with accompanying pictures and eight questions each of which required differentiation between two metacognitive verbs.

out_desc_tool: Means and SDs for treatment (high/low, boys/girls) combined to calculate the overall scores. A test of mathematics was devised comprising 60 questions covering the concept of number and the representation of numbers by symbols, simple rules of addition and subtraction, and number sequence and with more complex addition and subtraction.
out_desc_red: The Breakthrough to Literacy Reading Scheme (Mackay, Thompson & Schaub, 1970) was in common use in the school and was used as the criterion for progress in learning to read. It contained a 'sentence maker' designed to allow the learner to produce written language unaided by composing and arranging sentences using a limited supply of words, which were printed on cards. The child built up the number of words in his sentence maker as he learnt to read and use them. In addition to the Breakthrough materials, the school made use of reading books from a variety of reading schemes. The number of words in the sentence maker was used as the measure of progress in learning to read and to use language. This was considered preferable to a standardised reading test in view of the young age of the children.
out_desc_math: Means and SDs for treatment (high/low, boys/girls) combined to calculate the overall scores. A test of mathematics was devised comprising 60 questions covering the concept of number and the representation of numbers by symbols, simple rules of addition and subtraction, and number sequence and with more complex addition and subtraction.

out_tit_tool: The Informal Test of Inductive Reasoning I (ITIR-I)
out_desc_tool: The ITIR- I covers all six paradigms (Generalization, Discrimination, Cross Classification, Recognizing Relations, Discriminating Relations, and System Construction). Each paradigm is represented by three tasks, so the whole test consists of 18 tasks. The tasks share all the external characteris- tics of the Denktraining tasks  The tasks are presented mainly by way of pictures, are derived from the same contexts, cover the same subject matter, and are in the same format as the Denktraining tasks.

out_tit_tool: Cattell Test 1950 - Inductive Reasoning Questions - F test 4.6

out_desc_tool: Unadjusted mean pots-test scores of the Cattell's Culture Fair test. Test scores do not however include  the subtest "Mazes".

out_tit_tool: Raven’s Coloured Progressive Matrices (CPM) Reasoning Test - Metacognition
out_desc_tool: Post-test unadjusted mean mean score of a reasoning test
out_desc_math: Post-test unadjusted mean score of a researcher-designed mathematics test.

out_desc_tool: Raven Coloured Progressive Matrices Test (Set A) administered to the children. The Raven Coloured Progresive Matrices Test tasks are non- verbal inteligence tests  they are known as measures of fluid inteligence.
